critique: This executive order establishes a Transition Planning Office within the Office of Management and Budget to coordinate the establishment of the Department of Homeland Security. It is signed by George W. Bush. There is no information related to immigration, civil liberties, or social inclusion. The order does not seem to expand executive power significantly, as it is primarily focused on coordination and planning. It also does not seem to have a direct impact on economic regulation or federalism. Given the context of establishing the Department of Homeland Security after 9/11, a slight tilt towards national security is reasonable. The order itself is fairly neutral in terms of ideological tilt.
